result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua P. McKillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence and with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------------
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua P. McKillips in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Joshua P. McKillips in court, in custody via video with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 15GF917, 14CF515 & 15CF253
MUST POST $1000.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.P.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Joshua P. McKillips in court, in custody.  Atty Julia May appeared. Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders bond forfeited. Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua P. McKillips in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.   Atty Rea and Intern A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

**AMENDMENT 07/09/15 MUST POST $250.00 CASH** TOTAL BOND COVERS 14CF515 AND 15GF583 (15-2588)

*AMENDMENT 07/08/15* NO CONTACT WITH J.P. MODIFIED TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT.   "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM, J.P. EXCEPT FOR CONTACT WHILE IN CUSTODY AT THE ROCK COUNTY JAIL AND BY PHONE WHILE IN CUSTODY.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with Atty R. Hammock and Intern A. Hahn. Atty Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
